description: TO TABLE THE REPORT CONCERNING THE QUESTION OF THE CREDENTIALS OF MR. HUNTER, THE DELEGATE FROM THE TERRITORY OF MISSISSIPPI.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 1, TO APPORTION REPRESENTATIVES ACCORDING TO THE SECOND CENSUS, TO BE IN A RATIO OF ONE REPRESENTATIVE TO EVERY 33,000 PERSONS IN EACH STATE, TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE, IN ORDER TO AWAIT CERTAIN RETURNS OF THE NEW CENSUS.  (P. 392)
TO PASS H.R. 1, TO APPORTION REPRESENTATIVES ACCORDING TO THE SECOND CENSUS IN A RATIO OF ONE REPRESENTATIVE TO EVERY 33,000 PERSONS.

TO AGREE ON AN AMENDMENT TO THE STANDING RULES AND ORDERS WHICH AUTHORIZES THE SPEAKER TO ASSIGN STENOGRAPHERS TO SUCH PLACES ON THE FLOOR AS WILL NOT INTERFERE WITH THE CONVENIENCE OF THE HOUSE.

TO AMEND H.R. 7, TO FIX THE MILITARY PEACE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE UNITED STATES, IN ORDER TO ABOLISH THE OFFICE OF BRIGADIER GENERAL.

TO AMEND H.R. 7, BY ELIMINATING THE COMPENSATION GRANTED TO OFFICERS DERANGED AS A RESULT OF PEACETIME MILITARY REORGANIZATION IN ORDER TO GRANT GREATER COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS AGED IN SERVICE.  (P. 429)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE RESOLUTION TO INSTRUCT THE COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPEDIENCY OF REDUCING DUTIES ON SUGAR, COFFEE AND TEA.

TO APPEAL THE DECISIONS OF THE CHAIR AS TO WHETHER IT WAS IN ORDER TO USE CERTAIN EXPRESSIONS DURING CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION TO INSTRUCT THE COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS TO INQUIRE INTO THE LAWS LAYING IMPORT AND TONNAGE DUTIES, AND TO REPORT TO THE HOUSE.  (P. 447)

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO INSTRUCT COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS TO INQUIRE INTO EXPEDIENCY OF REDUCING THE DUTIES ON BROWN SUGAR, COFFEE AND TEA.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDED RESOLUTION TO INSTRUCT THE COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPEDIENCY OF REDUCING THE DUTY ON SALT AND ARTICLES OF NECESSARY CONSUMPTION; ESPECIALLY THOSE HARMFUL TO THE AGRICULTURAL AND MECHANICAL INTEREST OF THIS COUNTRY.  (P. 461)

TO CONCUR IN THE RESOLUTION OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE NOT TO ASSENT TO THE ACT OF THE LEGISLATURE OF THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY DECLARING THEIR ASSENT TO AN ALTERATION IN THE ORDINANCE FOR THE GOVERNMENT THEREOF.  (P. 466)
TO ESTABLISH A SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE RESOLUTION TO REPEAL ACTS RELATING TO THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A MINT.

TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION TO INSTRUCT THE COMMITTEE OF WAYS AND MEANS TO REPORT A BILL RELATING TO THE RESOLUTION TO REPEAL LAWS IMPOSING DUTIES ON STILLS, DOMESTIC DISTILLED SPIRITS, REFINED SUGAR, AND OTHER OBJECTS.
TO PASS THE BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE COLLECTION OF FEES DUE TO THE OFFICERS OF THE MARYLAND COURTS, FROM PERSONS RESIDING IN THE TERRITORY OF COLUMBIA.  (P. 494)

TO CONCUR WITH THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE IN THEIR RESOLUTION NOT TO HONOR THE CLAIM OF JOHN CARR, WHO SEEKS TO OBTAIN THE PAY AND EMOLUMENTS OF A LIEUTENANT AS IF HE HAD CONTINUED IN THE SERVICE OF THE U.S. UNTIL THE END OF THE WAR.  (P. 496)

TO AMEND S. 2, BY ADDING A NEW SECTION PROVIDING THAT ALL PROCEEDINGS OF A CRIMINAL, PENAL OR CIVIL NATURE WHICH HAVE BEEN COMMENCED IN A CIRCUIT COURT SHALL HAVE COGNIZANCE IN THE CIRCUIT COURTS REVIVED BY THIS ACT.  (P. 952)
TO AMEND S. 2, BY ADDING A SECTION CONCERNING SUITS, PROCESSES, PLEADINGS AND OTHER PROCEEDINGS OF THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE DISTRICT OF OHIO.
TO RECOMMIT S. 2, TO A SELECT COMMITTEE.

TO AMEND S. 2, SO AS TO TRANSFER PROCEEDINGS TO THE DISTRICT JUDGE OF THE DISTRICT WITHIN WHICH A COMMISSION OF BANK- BEEN ISSUED, FROM A CIRCUIT COURT OR JUDGE IN PERSUANCE TO RUPTCY HAS BEEN ISSUED, (FROM A CIRCUIT COURT OR JUDGE IN ACT. PURSUANCE TO ACT.

TO PASS H.R. 18, TO REVISE AND AMEND, THE ACTS CONCERNING NATURALIZATION.

TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR THAT A MOTION CONCERN- -ING H.R. 31 WAS NOT DIVISIBLE.  (P. 1021)

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE TO SUSTAIN THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR THAT A MOTION CONCERNING H.R. 31, WAS NOT DIVISIBLE.

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON THE MAIN QUESTION WHICH IS TO INSERT AFTER THE WORDS "STAMPED VELLUM, PARCHMENT AND PAPER", THE WORDS "DUTIES ON IMPORTED BROWN SUGAR."

TO APPEAL THE DECISION OF THE CHAIR THAT IT IS NOT IN ORDER TO ENGROSS H.R. 31, UNTIL THE MAIN QUESTION ON THE MOTION ON WHICH THE PREVIOUS QUESTION HAD BEEN CALLED FOR AND TAKEN, SHOULD BE PUT AND DECIDED BY THE HOUSE.
TO SUSTAIN A DECISION OF THE CHAIR RELATING TO ORDERING OF THE MAIN QUESTION.
TO AMEND H.R. 31, TO REPEAL THE TAX ON IMPORTED BROWN SUGAR.
TO AMEND H.R. 31 TO REPEAL THE TAX ON IMPORTED COFFEE.

TO PASS H.R. 31.

TO AMEND H.R. 25, A BILL TO CONTINUE IN FORCE AN ACT TO AUGMENT THE SALARIES OF CERTAIN OFFICERS; BY AUTHORIZING COMPENSATION IN THIS BILL, RATHER THAN TO REVIVE AN OLD BILL FOR THAT PURPOSE.

TO PASS H.R. 46.  (P. 1161)

TO AMEND H.R. 56, SO AS TO MAKE TWO DISTINCT AND SEPARATE EXCEPTIONS INVOLVING ANY DIFFICULTY IN MAKING REMITTANCES AND IN CASE THE ADVANCE UPON EXCHANGE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND HOLLAND SHALL EXCEED 5 %.

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO MAKE PROVISION BY LAW TO AUTHORIZE THE ATTORNEY GENERAL TO AGREE WITH THOSE INTERESTED IN THE AWARD OR REPORT OF ISAAC ROOSEVELT AND OTHERS, REFEREES BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND COMFORT SANDS AND OTHERS, ON A STATEMENT TO DETERMINE THE VALIDITY OF SAID AWARD OR REPORT BEFORE THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE U.S.

TO AMEND S. 9, A BILL TO AMEND THE JUDICIAL SYSTEM, TO OF THE UNITED STATES", AS PROVIDES FOR HOLDING A SESSION OF REPEAL SO MUCH OF THE ACT "TO ESTABLISH THE JUDICIAL COURTS THE SUPREME COURT ON AUG. 1, ANNUALLY.  (P. 1213)

TO RECOMMIT THE BILL TO PROVIDE MORE EFFECTIVELY FOR THE DUE APPLICATION OF PUBLIC MONEY, AND FOR THE ACCOUNTABILITY OF PERSONS ENTRUSTED THEREWITH, TO COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO FURTHER INVESTIGATE THE SUBJECT.

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE MESSAGE FROM THE PRESIDENT ACCOMPANIED BY A CONFIDENTIAL LETTER RECEIVED BY HIM RELATIVE TO A VIOLATION BY SPAIN OF OUR TREATY WITH THAT COUNTRY.  (P. 300)
TO PRINT THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE.  (P. 300)
TO COMMIT THE PRESIDENTS' MESSAGE TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE HOUSE.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION REGARDING OBSTRUCTION OF NAVIGATION ON THE MISSISSIPPI BY OFFICERS OF THE SPANISH GOVERNMENT, BY STRIKING THE CLAUSE WHICH EXPRESSES PERFECT CONFIDENCE IN THE WISDOM AND VIGILANCE OF THE EXECUTIVE FOR ASSERTING THE RIGHTS AND VINDICATING THE INJURIES OF THE U.S.
TO AGREE TO THE SECTION OF THE NAVIGATION ON THE MISSISSIPPI RESOLUTION WHICH EXONERATES THE KING OF SPAIN OF ANY BREACH OF FAITH, SETTING THE BLAME ON UNAUTHORIZED INDIVIDUALS.

TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JAMES LYNN OF N.J. AS SUPERVISOR FOR THE DISTRICT OF N.J.

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE BILL (APP. 3-8-02, 2 STAT. L. 132), REPEALING CERTAIN ACTS RESPECTING THE ORGANIZATION OF U.S. COURTS; WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO CONSIDER AND REPORT THE ALTERATIONS WHICH MAY BE PROPER IN THE JUDICIARY SYSTEM AND THE PROVISION TO BE MADE RESPECTING THE JUDGES OF THE CIRCUIT COURTS, ESTABLISHED BY THE ACT OF 2-13-01, IN CASE THE SAID ACT SHALL BE REPEALED.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM BILL.
TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE "FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM" WITH INSTRUCTIONS THAT SAID COMMITTEE CONSIDER AND REPORT THE ALTERATIONS WHICH MAY BE PROPER IN THE JUDICIARY SYSTEM.
TO DISCHARGE THE SELECT COMMITTEE FROM CONSIDERATION OF THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM BILL.
TO PASS THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM BILL.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL, (APP. 4-14-02, 2 STAT. L. 152), AUTHORIZING THE SETTLEMENT OF THE ACCOUNT OF SAMUEL DEXTER, FOR HIS EXPENSES IN DEFENDING AGAINST THE SUIT OF JOSEPH HODGSON.
TO PASS H.R. BILL (APP. 3-6-02, 6 STAT. L. 45), PROVIDING FOR THE RELIEF OF LYON LEHMAN.
TO AMEND THE FIRST SECTION OF THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM BILL, BY ADDING "EXCEPTING SO MUCH THEREOF AS RELATES TO THE COURTS THEREBY ESTABLISHED IN THE THIRD DISTRICT."
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL TO ALLOW A DRAWBACK OF DUTIES ON GOODS EXPORTED TO NEW ORLEANS, AND TO AMEND THE ACT TO REGULATE THE COLLECTION OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS AND TONNAGE.
TO PASS, AS AMENDED, THE BILL (APP. 3-16-02, 2 STAT. L. 132) FIXING THE MILITARY PEACE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE U.S.

TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO INQUIRE WHETHER ANY, AND WHAT AMENDMENTS ARE NECESSARY TO BE MADE IN THE ACT (APP. 4-30-02, 2 STAT. L. 150), ESTABLISHING THE JUDICIAL COURTS OF THE U.S. AND TO REPORT BY BILL OR OTHERWISE.

TO AMEND THE BILL (APP. 3-30-02, 2 STAT. L. 139), TO REGULATE TRADE AND INTERCOURSE WITH THE INDIAN TRIBES AND TO PRESERVE PEACE ON THE FRONTIERS, BY INSERTING IN THE 16TH SECTION THE WORDS:  "UNLESS UPON SPECIAL CAUSE TO BE CERTIFIED BY THE COMMANDING OFFICERS."

TO ADOPT THE COMMITTEE'S REPORT CONCERNING THE BILL, (APP. 4-6-02, 2 STAT. L. 148), REPEALING THE INTERNAL TAXES, SAID REPORT TO ELIMINATE THE EIGHTH SECTION PROVIDING REBATE ON TAXES PAID ON BLANKS, VELLUM, PARCHMENT OR PAPER, DEDUCTING THE TAX OF 17 1/2 % NOW DUE PROVIDED SUCH CLAIM IS PRESENTED BEFORE OCT. 31, 1802.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL, FOR THE BETTER SECURITY OF PUBLIC MONEYS AND PROPERTY IN THE HANDS OF PUBLIC OFFICERS AND AGENTS.
TO AMEND THE BILL RELATING TO "INTERNAL TAXES", BY MAKING THE DEDUCTION ON THE REFUND OF STAMPS SUBJECT TO A DEDUCTION OF ONLY 7 1/2% INSTEAD OF 17 1/2% AS PROVIDED.
TO PASS THE INTERNAL TAXES, BILL.
TO PASS THE H.R. BILL (APP. 4-14-02, 2 STAT. L. 155), TO REVISE AND AMEND THE NATURALIZATION LAW, AS AMENDED.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-14-02, 2 STAT. L. 152), REVIVING AND CONTINUING IN FORCE AN ACT ENTITLED, "AN ACT TO AUGMENT THE SALARIES OF THE OFFICERS THEREIN MENTIONED" (APP. 3-2-1799), SAID AMENDMENT TO PROVIDE A NEW SCHEDULE OF SALARIES FOR HIGH RANKING APPOINTED GOVERNMENT OFFICERS.
TO ADOPT A MOTION TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO EXAMINE AND REPORT WHAT REGULATIONS OUGHT TO BE ADOPTED RESPECTING THE LANDS CLAIMED BY THE UNITED STATES WITHIN THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.

TO AMEND THE S. BILL (APP. 4-29-02, 2 STAT, L. 156), PROVIDING FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE U.S. COURTS, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE ELEVENTH SECTION PROPOSING THAT THERE BE APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT FROM TIME TO TIME, AS MANY GENERAL COMMISSIONERS OF BANKRUPTCY IN EACH DISTRICT OF THE UNITED STATES AS HE MAY DEEM NECESSARY.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. 4-29-05, 2 STAT. L. 156), PROVIDING FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED STATES COURTS.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-14-02, 2 STAT. 6. 152), REVIVING AND CONTINUING IN FORCE AN ACT TO AUGMENT THE SALARIES OF OFFICERS THEREIN MENTIONED.
TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF CONELIUS LYMAN AS A CAPTAIN OF INFANTRY.

TO AMEND THE S. RESOLUTION REGARDING LANDS CLAIMED BY THE UNITED STATES WITHIN THE STATE OF TENNESSEE, SAID AMENDMENT TO ADD IN DESIGNATION OF THE LANDS CLAIMED BY THE U.S. WITHIN TENNESSEE, THOSE TO WHICH THE INDIAN CLAIMS ARE EXTINGISHED AND WHICH ARE NOT COVERED BY LEGAL TITLES UNDER THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO DIRECT THE ATTORNEY GENERAL TO HAVE BEFORE CONGRESS AT THE NEXT SESSION, ALL DOCUMENTS RELATIVE TO LAND CLAIMS IN TENNESSEE UNDER A DEED OF CESSION IN DECEMBER 1789, AND THE PROBABLE QUANTITY OF LAND WHICH MAY BE AT THE DISPOSITION OF THE U.S. WITH EXISTING INDIAN TRIBE TREATIES.

TO AMEND A HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-3-02, 2 STAT. L. 189), TO FURTHER ALTER AND ESTABLISH CERTAIN POST ROADS, SAID AMEND- MENT TO MAKE IT AN OFFENSE TO REFUSE THE RIGHT OF WAY WHEN POSSIBLE TO VEHICLES CARRYING MAIL, AND TO MAKE IT PUNISHABLE BY A FINE OF NOT MORE THAN $30. FOR EACH OFFENSE.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-29-02, 2 STAT. L. 167), PRO- VIDING FOR THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION ONE, "AND ALSO FUTURE LOANS WHICH MAY BE MADE REIMBURSING OR REDEEMING ANY INSTALLMENT OR PARTS OF THE PRINCIPAL OF THE SAID DEBTS."
TO AMEND THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT BILL, SAID AMEND- MENT TO STRIKE OUT THE FIFTH SECTION THE WORDS, "OR ANY INDIVIDUAL OR INDIVIDUALS."
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL, TO ESTABLISH THE GOVERNMENT OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO AMEND THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT BILL BY APPROP- RIATING TO THE SINKING FUND YEARLY, SO MUCH OF THE DUTIES ON MERCHANDISE AND TONNAGE, AS WILL AMOUNT, WITH THE MONEY ALREADY PROVIDED FOR THE SINKING FUND, TO $7,300,000.
TO PASS THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT BILL.
TO AGREE TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND GREAT BRITAIN.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-29-02, 2 STAT. L. 170), FOR THE RELIEF OF WIDOWS AND ORPHANS OF CERTAIN PERSONS DECEASED OR WHO MAY HEREAFTER DIE IN THE NAVAL SERVICE, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE SECOND SECTION WHICH PROVIDES FOR HALF PAY TO SURVIVORS OF ANY WARRANT OR COMMISSIONED OFFICER OF THE NAVY OR MARINES KILLED OR DROWNED WHILE IN SERVICE.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-29-02, 2 STAT. L. 471), FOR THE RELIEF OF THEODOSUIS FOWLER.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-30-02, 2 STAT. L. 173), ENABLING THE PEOPLE OF THE EASTERN DIVISION OF THE TERRITORY NORTHWEST OF THE OHIO RIVER, TO FORM A CONSTITUTION AND STATE GOVERNMENT; SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT CERTAIN PARTS OF THE SIXTH SECTION PROVIDING THAT THE CONVENTION OF SAID STATE SHALL ASSENT THAT ALL LAND SOLD BY CONGRESS FROM AND AFTER JUNE 30, NEXT, REMAIN TAX FREE OF ANY TAXES, FOR A TERM OF 5 YEARS FROM THE DATE OF SALE.

TO AMEND THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY BILL, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION SIX, THAT 1/20 OF THE NET PROCEEDS OF LANDS LYING WITHIN SAID STATES, SOLD BY CONGRESS FROM JUNE 13, NEXT, ON, SHALL BE APPLIED FOR CONSTRUCTING PUBLIC ROADS.

TO AMEND THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY BILL, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION SIX THE PROVISION THAT SIX MILES RESERVATION INCLUDING THE SCIOTO SALT SPRINGS, AND IN THE MILITARY TRACT WITH SECTIONS OF LAND INCLUSIVE, SHALL BE GRANTED TO SAID STATE FOR PUBLIC USE, UNDER TERMS, CONDITIONS AND REGULATION OF STATE LEGISLATURE, PROVIDING IT SHALL NEVER BE SOLD OR LEASED FOR A TERM OF MORE THAN TEN YEARS.

TO AMEND THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY BILL BY PREVENTING THE PROPOSED NEW STATE WHEN FORMED, FROM EVER DERIVING REVENUE FROM LEASING CERTAIN TRACKS OF LAND CONTAINING SALT SPRINGS, THUS KEEPING SAID SALT SPRINGS FOR THE FREE USE OF THE PEOPLE.

TO AMEND THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY BILL BY STRIKING OUT FROM THE 6TH SECTION THE WORD, "SOLD", AND INSERTING "GRANTED", SO THAT EVERY TRACT OF LAND GRANTED BY CONGRESS, FROM AND AFTER JUNE 30TH, NEXT, SHALL BE AND REMAIN TAX EXEMPT FOR FIVE YEARS.
TO PASS THE NORTHWESTERN TERRITORY  BILL AS AMENDED.

TO AMEND THE TREATY BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHICKASAW INDIANS MADE AT CHICKASAW BLUFFS ON 10-24-01, BY ELIMINATING THEREFROM THE WORDS - "TO ASSIST THE CHICKASAWS TO PRESERVE ENTIRE, ALL THEIR RIGHTS AGAINST THE ENCROACHMENTS OF UNJUST NEIGHBORS, OF WHICH HE SHALL BE THE JUDGE".
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT THAT THE PRESIDENT DO RATIFY THE TREATY OF RECIPROCAL ADVANTAGE AND MUTUAL CONVENIENCE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHICKASAW NATION OF INDIANS.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT TO HAVE THE PRESIDENT RATIFY THE TREATY OF FRIENDSHIP, LIMITS AND ACCOMODATIONS, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHOCTAW NATION OF INDIANS.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-1-02, 2 STAT. L. 178), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE U.S. NAVY FOR 1802, SAID AMENDMENT TO ADD A NEW SECTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO DISMISS AS MANY OF THE OFFICERS OF THE MARINE CORPS AS WILL REDUCE THEIR NUMBER AND GRADES IN LEGAL PRO- PORTION TO THE NUMBER OF MARINES RETAINED IN SERVICE.
TO PASS HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-1-02, 2 STAT. L. 178), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE NAVY FOR 1802.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO BRING IN A BILL REPEALING SO MUCH OF ANY EXISTING LAW AUTHORIZING A CERTAIN PROVISIONARY AGREEMENT, MADY BY COMMISSIONERS OF THE UNITED STATES AND THE STATE OF GEORGIA AND DATED APR. 24, 1802, AND WHICH MAY BE BINDING AND CONCLUSIVE ON THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-3-02, 2 STAT. L. 195), TO INCORPORATE THE INHABITANTS OF THE CITY OF WASHINGTON IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-3-02, 2 STAT. L. 192), FOR THE RELIEF OF SICK AND DISABLED SEAMEN.

TO CONCUR IN THE HOUSE RESOLUTION PROPOSING TWO AMENDMENTS TO THE CONSTITUTION RELATING TO THE ELECTION OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT, BY AEVING THE VOTERS DESIGNATE THE PERSONS VOTED FOR AS PRESIDENT AND AS VICE PRESIDENT.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF TREATY MADE AT ALBANY, N.Y., AUG. 20, 1802, BETWEEN THE STATE OF N.Y., AND THE SENECA TRIBE OF INDIANS.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY, MADE UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE U.S., BETWEEN THE STATE OF N.Y., AND THE ONEIDA NATION OF INDIANS ON 6-4-02.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY OF LIMITS BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CREEK NATION OF INDIANS, MADE ON 6-16-02.

TO POSTPONE TO THE FIRST MONDAY IN DEC. CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL TO CARRY INTO EFFECT VARIOUS CONGRESSIONAL RESOLUTIONS FOR THE ERECTION OF MONUMENTS TO THE MEMORY OF GENERALS WOOSTER, HERKIMER, DAVIDSON, AND SCRIVIN.
TO PASS THE BILL TO CARRY INTO EFFECT THE VARIOUS   ************** CONGRESSIONAL RESOLUTIONS TO ERECT MONUMENTS TO THE MEMORY OF GENERALS WOOSTER, HERKIMER, DAVIDSON, AND SCRIVIN.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY MADE UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE U.S., BETWEEN THE SENECA NATION OF INDIANS AND WILHEM WILLINK AND OTHERS, OF THE REPUBLIC OF BATAWIA; DATED JUNE 30, 1802.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHOCTAW NATION OF INDIANS, MADE ON OCT. 17, 1802.

TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF JAMES MONROE TO BE MINISTER EXTRAORDINARY AND PLENIPOTENTIARY, TO ENTER INTO TREATY ON CONVENTION WITH THE FIRST CONSUL OF FRANCE, FOR ENLARGING AND MORE EFFECTUALLY SECURING OUR RIGHTS AND INTERESTS IN THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND SPAIN.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY BETWEEN THE SENECA INDIANS AND OLIVER PHELPS AND OTHERS, MADE ON 6-30-02.

TO AMEND THE BILL MAKING FURTHER PROVISIONS FOR THE EXPENSES ATTENDING THE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FOREIGN NATIONS, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE WORDS: "OF DEFRAYING ANY EXTRAORDINARY EXPENSES WHICH MAY BE INCURRED IN THE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND FOREIGN NATIONS," AND INSERT THE WORDS:  "OF MAKING SUCH PAYMENT FOR THE CESSION OF THE ISLAND OF NEW ORLEANS, OR OTHER TERRITORIES, TO THE UNITED STATES, AS MAY BE STIPULATED BY THE PRESIDENT BY TREATY WITH FOREIGN NATIONS CLAIMING THE JURISDICTION AND SOVEREIGNTY THEREOF."
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL PROVIDING FOR EXPENSES ATTENDING THE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FOREIGN NATIONS.
TO PASS THE BILL PROVIDING FOR EXPENSES ATTENDING THE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND FOREIGN NATIONS.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE TO GIVE TO WILLIAM MARBURY, ROBERT T. HOOE, AND DEVIS RAMSAY AN ATTESTED COPY OF THE PROCEEDINGS OF MAR. 2 AND 3, 1801, RELATIVE TO THEIR APPOINTMENT AS JUSTICES OF THE PEACE IN WASHINGTON AND ALEXANDRIA IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO CAUSE A "QUO WARRANTO" PROCEEDING TO BE FILED BY THE ATTORNEY GENERAL AGAINST RICHARD BASSET FOR THE PURPOSE OF TESTING THE VALIDITY OF THE ACT OF MAR. 8, 1802, REPEALING THE ACT OF FEB. 13, 1801, ESTABLISHING CERTAIN INFERIOR COURTS.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION ASSERTING THE RIGHT OF THE U.S. TO FREE NAVIGATION OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER, AND TO A PLACE OF DEPOSIT FOR THEIR PRODUCTS IN THE ISLAND OF NEW ORLEANS, THAT THE LATE INFRACTION OF THAT RIGHT (BY SPAIN) IS A HOSTILE AGGRESSION, AND AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO SEIZE SUCH PLACES AS HE MAY DEEM CONVENIENT AND TO SUSTAIN THEIR RIGHTS BY THE MILITIA, FOR WHICH AN APPROPRIATION IS MADE; SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE FIRST SECTION ASSERTING THEIR RIGHTS AND CHARACTERIZING THE INFRACTION AS A HOSTILE AGGRESSION.
TO AMEND THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER RESOLUTION, ELIMINATING THE SECOND SECTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO USE THE ARMED FORCES OF THE U.S. TO TAKE POSSESSION OF THE ISLAND OF NEW ORLEANS.

TO AMEND THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER RESOLUTION BY AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO REQUIRE THE EXECUTIVES OF THE SEVERAL STATES TO ARM AND EQUIP 80,000 MILITIA, PROVIDING FOR ONE OR MORE ARSENALS ON THE WESTERN WATERS AND MAKING AN APPROPRIATION THEREFOR.
TO PASS THE AMENDED BILL TO INCORPORATE AN INSURANCE COMPANY IN THE CITY OF WASHINGTON.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE TUSCARORA NATION OF INDIANS, MADE ON DEC. 4, 1802.
TO POSTPONE TO MARCH 4, NEXT,  CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL TO REDUCE THE MARINE CORPS.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL (APP. 3-3-03, 2 STAT. L. 215), TO PROVIDE MORE EFFECTUALLY FOR THE ORGANIZATION OF THE MILITIA OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. 3-3-03, 2 STAT. L. 215), TO PROVIDE MORE EFFECTUALLY FOR THE ORGANIZATION OF THE MILITIA OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND SPAIN CONCLUDED AT MADRID ON AUG. 11, 1802.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND SPAIN CONCLUDED AT MADRID ON AUG. 11, 1802.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. 3-3-03, 6 STAT. L. 50), FOR JOSHIA HARVEY AND OTHERS, ASKING RELIEF FROM BONDS AS PRINCIPLE AND SECURITIES FOR THE PAYMENT OF DUTIES, HAVING BEEN DISCHARGED FROM BANKRUPTCY.
TO POSTPONE TO MARCH 4, NEXT, CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION FOR THE ELECTION OF THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE AND OTHER OFFICERS.
